settings.title: Description
settings.content:
Keep your hands dry and comfortable with DRYE gloves – the first gloves that actively wick moisture away from the skin for long-term relief. Developed over seven years in collaboration with Sweden’s top research institutions, these gloves use advanced moisture-wicking technology to help reduce issues like eczema, dermatitis, and Raynaud’s.

Made from sustainable wood cellulose, DRYE gloves create a breathable, hypoallergenic barrier that is gentle on the skin and designed for daily use. Unlike cotton, bamboo, and silk, DRYE gloves offer superior moisture control, making them a better choice for people with skin issues.

Continual use has been shown to reduce the need for costly creams and ointments. Lifespan: 3–12 months.

settings.title: How to use
settings.content:
To get the best results from your DRYE eczema-friendly gloves, follow these simple steps:

1. Start with Clean, Dry Hands: Before wearing your DRYE gloves, ensure your hands are clean and dry. This helps prevent trapped moisture, which could lead to irritation or discomfort. Proper hand hygiene is key to effective skin protection.

2. Wear Under Gloves for Extra Protection: DRYE gloves can be worn under work, sport, or protective gloves for added protection. This extra layer helps shield your skin from dryness and irritants while allowing for comfort and full mobility.

3. Wear Daily for Consistent Relief: For lasting relief from eczema, dry, or cracked skin, wear DRYE gloves daily. Regular use soothes skin, reduces flare-ups, and maintains a protective barrier against environmental triggers. Make them part of your daily routine for the best results.

4. Wash & Reuse for Long-Term Durability: DRYE gloves are machine washable up to 90°C. After washing, air dry to maintain softness and effectiveness. Reuse regularly for continuous support, keeping the gloves fresh, hygienic, and durable

settings.title: Areas of use
settings.content:
DRYE Eczema Gloves are the perfect choice for:

Individuals with Skin Conditions: Alleviate symptoms of eczema, psoriasis, atopic dermatitis, and Raynaud's disease. The moisture-wicking properties help protect against common irritants, creating a dry, comfortable environment for sensitive skin. These gloves provide a superior solution for eczema sufferers, offering better moisture control and skin protection.

Athletes: For those engaging in high-intensity activities, these gloves provide dependable moisture control, reducing friction and maintaining grip. Whether you're a hockey player, cross-country skier, or gym enthusiast, DRYE gloves support optimal performance and comfort, providing a better alternative to nitrile gloves or organic cotton gloves in sports environments.

Industry Workers: Designed to withstand demanding environments, DRYE gloves are compatible with protective gear and can be comfortably worn for extended periods. Ideal for mechanics, construction workers, and those in labor-intensive fields, they keep hands dry and shielded from the rigors of the job, offering greater comfort than other gloves. They provide lasting eczema relief while also being an effective solution for sore hands caused by prolonged exposure to harsh conditions.

settings.title: Why is DRYE Liner more expensive than traditional glove liners?
settings.content:
DRYE Liner is more expensive than traditional alternatives due to our advanced anti-sweat technology, which effectively keeps moisture away from the skin layer for most of the day or night. This is crucial because moisture often exacerbates skin problems like dryness, redness, irritation, or cracks.

Traditional alternatives only absorb moisture, which leads to wet gloves that, in turn, can worsen the condition of the skin. This can result in the need for more moisturizing treatments, cortisone, as well as causing pain and sleeplessness.

The gloves are washable and reusable for 3-12 months, made in Sweden, and are biodegradable with a reduced environmental impact. They also offer long-term cost efficiency compared to traditional alternatives in cotton, bamboo, or silk, thanks to our effective moisture control.

- Wilhelm Bäckström, founder of DRYE

settings.title: Sweat: The Invisible Aggravator for Billions
settings.content:
Whether you're a hockey player, mining worker, home fixer, cleaner, or hairdresser, daily wear and sweaty gloves are a common struggle.

Prolonged exposure to moisture can worsen skin conditions like sensitive skin and eczema.

That’s why our textile combination offers a more advanced, innovative, and functional solution for situations where effective moisture management is essential—whether for work, sports, or sleep.

settings.title: "A Breakthrough In Hand Protection"
settings.content:
In collaboration with RISE, Uppsala University, and the Swedish School of Textiles in Borås, we conducted a thorough evaluation and testing of various material combinations over seven years.

Our mission was to find materials that prevent allergies, maintain precision, and offer maximum moisture management.

The result is DRYE Liner, "a breakthrough in hand protection."

This ultra-thin, two-layer material wicks away moisture, keeping your skin dry and irritation-free, no matter the intensity of your work.

Its innovative fabric combination of absorbent and moisture-wicking layers is designed to meet the demands of professionals facing daily hand challenges.

settings.title: Saving Billions of Liters of Water
settings.content:
1. Our advanced textile is developed with a focus on minimizing environmental impact throughout the entire production chain.

2. The manufacturing process uses raw materials from sustainable sources, requiring significantly less water and fewer resources compared to traditional alternatives. For example, it takes 30–50,000 liters of water to produce one kilogram of cotton, while our process will save billions of liters of water annually.

3. Through an efficient and closed-loop production process, most resources are recycled, drastically reducing emissions and waste.

4. The products have a lifespan of 3 to 12 months and are designed to be washable. This reduces waste and contributes to more sustainable use. Our textiles are also recyclable and biodegradable, further reducing environmental impact and supporting a circular economy.

settings.title: A new liner designed to keep moisture away from the skin layer
Why should I pre-order?
settings.content: Pre-ordering now ensures that you'll receive our brand-new product before it's launched in a couple of months. By doing so, you bypass the waiting period of an additional month and gain early access to our DRYE SweatGuard Liner.

settings.title: When will I get my delivery?
settings.content:
Once we close the 30-day pre-order period, it takes approximately 2-4 weeks for our manufacturer to deliver to us, after which we promptly ship your order.

You'll receive a delivery confirmation via email once your order is dispatched.

Orders are processed and packaged within 1-2 days upon arrival at our facility in Sweden.

Estimated Delivery Times:

  1. Within Sweden: PostNord: 4-7 working days.
  2. To Norway, Denmark, and Finland: 6-10 working days
  3. To the Netherlands, Austria, and France: 3-5 days
  4. For US and Canada: 7-14 days

Disclaimer about Delays:
Please note that unforeseen circumstances beyond our control, such as natural disasters, strikes, or transportation issues, may lead to delays. While we strive to ensure prompt delivery, we appreciate your understanding in such situations.

settings.title: How do I know that I will get my delivery in time?
settings.content: To keep you informed about your order's progress, we'll send weekly emails throughout the process. This way, you can track your delivery's status and rest assured it will arrive on time. If you have any concerns or queries about your delivery, feel free to reach out to us.

settings.title: Why should I use this glove?
settings.content: Our glove is a natural replacement for traditional materials like cotton, silk, and bamboo, as it effectively wicks moisture away from the skin layer for extended periods. Moisture buildup is a key trigger for conditions like pompholyx, dermatitis, and eczema, leading to dry, itchy, and scaly hands.

settings.title: What makes the gloves different?
settings.content:
Unlike traditional alternatives, keeps moisture away and wicks moisture away from the skin layer—regardless of how long you work, train, or sleep. This new textile technology and glove have shown promising results in Sweden for individuals suffering from hand eczema, cracking, redness, and dry skin.

More about research, collaborations, evidence, and before-and-after results can be found under 'News (click here)' or 'About Us (click here)'.

settings.title: Does this fall under PPE Regulation?
settings.content:
CE mark a product according to the PPE Regulation, it can only be done if the product meets the requirements for Personal Protective Equipment (PPE), and an inner glove does not qualify as personal protective equipment.

To be considered PPE, the product must protect against external risks to varying degrees, which an inner glove does not do.

This formulation comes from RISE itself.

Contact us here (click here) for more information or questions regarding your business and your inquiry.

settings.title: How does it work?
settings.content:
• Work & Home: The glove can be worn under other gloves during work tasks or household chores to help keep hands dry and extend the lifespan of those gloves.
  • Sleep & Training: It can also be worn overnight for moisture control while sleeping or during workouts to maintain comfort.
  • Adventure & Travel: These gloves can be useful for outdoor activities and travel, helping to keep hands dry and comfortable under other gloves.

settings.title: Why is this eczema glove more expensive than traditional ones?
settings.content: The gloves are priced higher than traditional alternatives because they use advanced anti-sweat technology to keep moisture away from the skin for extended periods. This is important, as moisture can aggravate skin issues like dryness, redness, irritation, and cracks. Traditional liners tend to absorb moisture, leading to wet gloves that can worsen skin conditions. These gloves are washable and reusable, lasting 3 to 12 months.

settings.title: How long does these gloves last?
settings.content: With proper care, the liner is intended to last between 3 to 12 months, though actual durability may vary based on usage and handling.

settings.title: Are these gloves only for people with dry and sensitive hands?
settings.content: These gloves provide protection against sweat and irritation for all users. They can be worn comfortably under various types of gloves, including leather, work, surgical, rubber, household, and disposable gloves.

settings.title: What are the washing instructions?
settings.content: Machine wash the liner at up to 60 degrees. For a fresh feel, some users prefer to hand wash them every few days to maintain their condition.

settings.title: What kind of material is it?
settings.content: While the patent application is ongoing, it can be shared that this liner is made from absorbent and moisture-transporting materials that are non-allergenic and gentle on the skin.

settings.title: Can these gloves be used in healthcare?
settings.content: Yes, absolutely. While there's no legislation prohibiting the use of our glove liner in healthcare, it's ultimately the employer's decision. Many individuals purchase and use them for personal and work-related hygiene needs.

settings.title: What are the unique features of the textile?
settings.content: The unique design combines absorbent and moisture-transferring materials, focusing on effective moisture management. The absorbent layer collects sweat from the skin and transports it away, helping to keep hands dry.

settings.title: Does these gloves affect accuracy?
settings.content: In tests with professional groups across Sweden, only cold buffet managers and hairdressers reported challenges when working with double gloves. The super-thin material of these gloves typically does not affect accuracy, and we've received minimal complaints.

settings.title: How does the textile differ from, for example, Dryfit?
settings.content: This textile differs from traditional polyester often found in the fitness industry by incorporating a unique material combination that enhances moisture transport. It is specifically designed to cater to individuals with sensitive, dry skin or eczema.

settings.title: "I founded DRYE not just as a business idea; I did it because I wish something like this had existed 20 years ago, when I needed it the most." - Wilhelm Bäckström
